intro: Klasea lusitanica, commonly known as the Iberian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Portugal and Spain. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Klasea lusitanica is a perennial herb that produces small, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological and historical significance.
